questions.question: Which statement is an example of active listening strategy VALIDATE?

choices.answer: Would you like a bag of chips?
I can see where you're coming from.....

imageMetadata.altText: Teenage Boy And Girl Having Conversation Using Sign Language

questions.question: Which statement is the best example of the active listening strategy REFLECT?

choices.answer: You seem to be worried about loosing a friend?
How long have you been friends?
I think you should just not talk to each other.

imageMetadata.altText: Art World Excitement As Rare Velazquez Painting Is Unearthed by Bonhams

questions.question: Asking good QUESTIONS helps everyone understand details and needs.

imageMetadata.altText: Wide Angle View Of High School Students Sitting At Desks In Classroom Using Laptops

questions.question: When you are RESTATING during active listening you should....

choices.answer: Repeat back word for word what the speaker said.
Tell your own story about what has happened to you in the past.
Ask the speaker to repeat what they said.
Rephrase what the speaker said using polite language.

imageMetadata.altText: Mural By Graffiti Artist Kenny Scharf Is Latest Work To Adorn Bowery Mural Wall

questions.question: REFLECTING and VALIDATING are similar however, reflecting focuses on feelings

imageMetadata.altText: Thoughtful girl sitting on sill embracing knees looking at window
